title: Todoist
description: Interact with Todoist to manage your tasks.
creator: abhiz123

commandInfo.guide:
Getting a Todoist API Token
Log in to your Todoist account
Navigate to Settings â†’ Integrations
Find your API token under "Developer"

documentation:
## Example Usage

### Creating Tasks
```
"Create task 'Team Meeting'"
"Add task 'Review PR' due tomorrow at 2pm"
"Create high priority task 'Fix bug' with description 'Critical performance issue'"
```

### Getting Tasks
```
"Show all my tasks"
"List tasks due today"
"Get high priority tasks"
"Show tasks due this week"
```

### Updating Tasks
```
"Update documentation task to be due next week"
"Change priority of bug fix task to urgent"
"Add description to team meeting task"
```

### Completing Tasks
```
"Mark the PR review task as complete"
"Complete the documentation task"
```

### Deleting Tasks
```
"Delete the PR review task"
"Remove meeting prep task"
```

title: Linear
description: Allows LLM to interact with Linear's API for project management, including searching, creating, and updating issues.
creator: jerhadf

commandInfo.guide: Create or get a Linear API key for your team: [https://linear.app/YOUR-TEAM/settings/api](https://linear.app/YOUR-TEAM/settings/api)

documentation:
## Usage examples

Some example prompts you can use with Claude Desktop to interact with Linear:

1. "Show me all my high-priority issues" → execute the `search_issues` tool and/or `linear-user:///{userId}/assigned` to find issues assigned to you with priority 1

2. "Based on what I've told you about this bug already, make a bug report for the authentication system" → use `create_issue` to create a new high-priority issue with appropriate details and status tracking

3. "Find all in progress frontend tasks" → use `search_issues` to locate frontend-related issues with in progress task

4. "Give me a summary of recent updates on the issues for mobile app development" → use `search_issues` to identify the relevant issue(s), then `linear-issue:///{issueId}` fetch the issue details and show recent activity and comments

5. "What's the current workload for the mobile team?" → combine `linear-team:///{teamId}/issues` and `search_issues` to analyze issue distribution and priorities across the mobile team

title: X(Twitter)
description: Interact with twitter API. Post tweets and search for tweets by query.
creator: EnesCinr

commandInfo.guide: Create a Twitter Developer account and get your API keys from [Twitter Developer Portal](https://developer.twitter.com/en/portal/dashboard)

documentation:
## Example Usage

Try asking Claude:
- "Can you post a tweet saying 'Hello from Claude!'"
- "Can you search for tweets about Claude AI?"

title: Contentful
description: An MCP server implementation that integrates with Contentful's Content Management API, providing comprehensive content management capabilities.
creator: Ivo Toby (Contentful)
documentation:
# Manage your content from agents

You can use the Contentful MCP server to manage your content from your agents, like Claude Desktop. Here are some examples of what you can do:

- Create a new entry in a content type
- Update an existing entry
- Create content type and populate it based on other content, and much much more.
